metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39275 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ap_escape_quotes() may write beyond the end of a buffer when given malicious input. No included modules pass untrusted data to these functions, but third-party / external modules may. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.48 and earlier.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39275` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-bin - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-data - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-utils - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2').
